definition: stroke count (number of brushstrokes of a Chinese character)
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: She can even look at a line of characters and meanwhile read out their stroke numbers, just like reading a text.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至能像读课文一样流利读出一排文字的笔画数。

sentences.english: Am I not up-to-date or not correct on the number of strokes?
sentences.chinese: 我该不该更新和改正不正确的笔画数呢？

definition: component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
variant of 筆畫|笔画[bi3 hua4]
five-stroke code, Chinese character input method
name of "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85)/see also 氵[shui3]
four corner code (input method for Chinese characters)
character with two or more readings
